basic_info.name: Tata Altroz 2025
basic_info.description: Tata Altroz 2025 is a 5-seater Hatchback available at a starting price of Rs. 6.3 Lakh. The car is available in 22 variants, with 3 engine and 3 transmission option. Additionally, 2025 Altroz offers a Ground Clearance measurement of 165 mm and a Boot capacity of 345 liters. You can choose from 5 colors for the 2025 Altroz. The mileage of the 2025 Altroz varies from 19 - 19.1 KM/L depending on the model.

engine.power: 72 bhp @ 6000 rpm,86 bhp @ 6000 rpm,89 bhp @ 4000 rpm bhp

Introduction: The Altroz is a premium hatchback, designed for daily city use and occasional long drives.
This subcompact car was first revealed at the 89th Geneva International Motor Show.
It comes with different engine options, so one can pick what suits their running and fuel preference.
There are many features like a sunroof, connected tech, wireless charging and more according to its variants.
Safety is a big selling point of the Altroz as it has scored five stars in both adult and child occupants in 2023.
Exterior: The fascia features sharp and swept-back headlamps at the front, which use LED projectors on higher versions.
Slim and eyebrow-styled DRLs stay on while on the go, make it easier to spot.
A wide, black front grille stretches across the nose with a textured pattern and the Tata logo in the middle.
Its sculpted front bumper with sharp lines and separate housings for fog lamps on other variants, give it a sporty look.
Flush-fitting front door handles on newer models sit almost flat against the body, which help slightly with aerodynamics.
The rear door handles are hidden near the back window, making its side possibly resemble a two-door car.
On the top, some variants get a contrasting black roof and an electric sunroof.
At the back, the car features connected LED tail-lamps, a glossy black panel, a chunky rear bumper and a small roof spoiler.
Interior: Step inside, and the cabin has a stylish dual-tone black and beige theme, giving it a fresh look with a layered dashboard design.
The Altroz’s seating is spacious and comfortable front seats placed at a normal height.
Then, the rear seats have adjustable headrests and a centre armrest with cup holders for extra comfort.
It comes with a with a modern 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system that’s clear and easy to use.
While, paired with the infotainment is a digital driver’s display that shows all important information.
An automatic climate control with rear AC vents and a quick-cool express function keeps the cabin cool as required.
The premium hatchback has smart conveniences like push-button start/stop, keyless entry, cruise control and more.
An ambient lighting adds colour as per taste, and there’s a single-pane sunroof that can be opened using voice commands.
Storage options include bottle holders in all doors, a cooled glovebox, an umbrella holder, and spaces in door pockets.
The steering wheel is wrapped in leather and packed with controls for managing audio and calls.
Additional perks include wireless phone charging and a sound system that can go up to eight speakers in higher variants.
Powertrain: The Altroz is powered by a 1.2-litre petrol engine which produces an output of 90bhp and 200Nm of torque.
This engine can be mated to a five-speed manual or a six-speed automatic transmission as per choice.
There is also a diesel variant with a 1.5-litre turbocharged engine delivering 91.2bhp and 200Nm of torque.
Additionally, the Altroz offers a 1.2-litre CNG engine option which generates an output of 73bhp and 103Nm of torque.
The Altroz’s CNG variant, however, only comes mated to a five-speed manual, like the diesel variant.

verdict: The Tata Altroz facelift brings in modern tech with a premium design, especially with its new bold grille and LED lighting. Features like a 10.25-inch touchscreen are latest to its segment, but the good thing is, it continues to boast a five-star safety rating (Bharat NCAP) across petrol, diesel, and CNG variants. So, with multiple powertrain options, adequate comfort, safety, and style; it shines in its segment.
